hints.content:
If we have $3$ $\heartsuit$s, is that the same as having $\heartsuit$ plus $6$ ?

$\heartsuit \times 3\stackrel{?}{=}\heartsuit + 6$

Let's use the table to check.

$\heartsuit$ | $\heartsuit\times 3$ | $\heartsuit \times 3\stackrel{?}{=}\heartsuit + 6$
-: |-: |-: |-: | :-:
$1$ | $3$ | $1+6\neq3$
$2$ | $6$ | $2+6\neq6$
$3$ | $9$ | $3+6\stackrel{\checkmark}=9$
$4$ | $12$ | $4+6\neq12$
$5$ | $15$ | $5+6\neq15$
$6$ | $18$ | $6+6\neq18$
$7$ | $21$ | $7+6\neq21$
$8$ | $24$ | $8+6\neq24$
$9$ | $27$ | $9+6\neq27$
$10$ | $30$ | $10+6\neq30$

For the factors in the table, the statement is sometimes true.
When we multiply by $3$, we *sometimes* get the same value as if we added $6$.
